title: TIME SERIES
text:
The purpose of this site is to offer an analysis on different time series forecasting techniques.
Some techniques are more advance than other, and more will be added to the site in the future, so stay tuned!



This site is not meant to fulfill any type of financial advice.
Please be cautious regarding the conclusions extracted, again:
PLEASE DON’T TAKE THIS AS FINANCIAL ADVICE!!

title: Notebook
text:
import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import Markdown
test_csv = pd.read_csv("test_csv.csv")
Markdown(test_csv.to_markdown(index=False))

title: Notebook
text:
Polar Axis
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis







Code
df=pd.DataFrame([[1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]], columns=['a', 'b', 'c'])
df










a
b
c




0
1
2
3


1
4
5
6


2
7
8

title: Arima Model
text:
Code
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from display_data import plot_fit_and_forecast, table_horizontal, plot_sample_data

title: Arima Model
text:
Latest stock values for analysis

We are using values from IBEX ticker values (Spanish stock values) every Friday - Closing
These are the lates values we used for our analysis.



Code
plot_sample_data(path='modelled_fitted_data.csv', column='Close')










Close


Date





2024-05-16
11152.0


2024-05-23
11339.5


2024-05-30
11325.5


2024-06-06
11397.2


2024-06-13
11357.2

title: Arima Model
text:
Test over last 8 weeks

We keep data from last 8 weeks ‘unseen’ by our arima model. 
This means that the model doesn’t know the last 8 values. The hypothetical present of our model is 8 weeks in the past. 
In that hypothetical present, if we could see the future we would see the last 8 weeks.



Code
table_horizontal(path='modelled_fitted_data.csv', column='Close', display_weeks=16)

title: Arima Model
section: Plot real vales vs model output and confidence intervals
text:
Plot real vales vs model output and confidence intervals
This is a plot of the real values (in blue) and the model output (in green) and the confident intervals (in red)


Code
plot_fit_and_forecast(path='modelled_fitted_data.csv', column='Close', model='arima',  display_weeks=16)
